attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I believe the 10p tax band should be re-instated because  it is unfair to  workers on low incomes.
 
Tax credits are not an answer to removing the low rate of tax for these reasons:

1) Most low income earners are living
with a partner and do not qualify for 
significant tax credit. For example a couple with joint income of £24,000
are losing about £430 in tax and get no tax credits (according to the tax credit website calculator)

2)Whilst a low income earner may be living with a partner with a
good income who could apparently afford to support them, he/she may have other commitments such as making hefty maintenance payments for children.

3)Tax credits are complicated & expensive to administer and fraught with 
under & overpayment problems.

4) Tax credit claimants have to go through the stress & humiliation of being means tested and may be accused of cohabitation, when no such sexual relationship or financial support exists.

5) It is humiliating for a person in a relationship, who is working full time, to not be able to pay their half of the ever increasing bills, simply because their tax has been increased to an unfair level.
